meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food yucked me out.
meanings.sent2: I yucked at the sight of the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent3: The smell of the garbage yucked me out so much, I had to hold my nose.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie yucked me out more than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk yucked me out with its sour taste.

meanings.definition: To have a negative reaction to something.
meanings.sent1: She yucked when she saw the messy room.
meanings.sent2: I always yuck at the thought of eating raw onions.
meanings.sent3: The strange noise from the old house made me yuck in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The bad news yucked me, leaving me feeling down.
meanings.sent5: The bitter medicine yucked me with its awful taste.

meanings.definition: To be grossed out or turned off.
meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food yucked me out.
meanings.sent2: I yucked at the sight of the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent3: The smell of the garbage yucked me out so much, I had to hold my nose.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie yucked me out more than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk yucked me out with its sour taste.
